titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
University Productions poster collection, 1936-2012
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Hannah Gulick, 2013

did.abstract: Various posters advertising theatrical and musical productions put on by the University of Michigan School of Music, Theatre & Dance and related units ranging from 1936 to the present. Includes posters from the Department of Speech (before the School of Music had a separate theatre department). Dance Company, Department of Music, Department of Musical Theater, Department of Theater and Drama, and the Opera Theater program.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by University Productions (Donor No. 7556) beginning in 1988.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, University Productions poster collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: University Productions is the unit responsible for University of Michigan School of Music, Theatre & Dance productions. Productions include both professional productions and university productions in dance, theatre, opera, and musical theatre. The unit has been responsible for managing music and theatre facilities, including Hill Auditorium, Lydia Mendelssohn Theatre, Power Center for the Performing Arts, Rackham Auditorium, and Trueblood Theatre.
Earlier theatrical productions were done under the auspices of the Department of Speech which incorporated theatre before theatre and drama became a separate department after 1979.

scopecontent.p: The University Productions posters collection contains posters largely created by University Productions which handles music, dance, voice, and theatre productions for the University of Michigan School of Music, Theatre & Dance. The poster collection is arranged in eight series: Collage Concerts, Dance Company, Department of Music, Department of Musical Theater, Department of Speech, Department of Theater and Drama, Opera Theater and Oversize Files.

controlaccess.head: Subjects - Visual Materials:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Professional Theatre Program.
University of Michigan. School of Music.
University of Michigan. Dept. of Speech.

scopecontent.p: Collage Concerts (0.1 linear feet, 2007-2012) are combined shows of theater, music, and dance.
The Dance Company (0.5 linear feet, 1980-2012) series contains posters advertising the productions of the University Dance Company under the Department of Dance.

did.unittitle: Dances of Passion, Rhythm and Heat, 2001
Eurythmy: Visible Speech and Visible Song, 1957

unittitle.title: The Unicorn, the Gorgon and the Manticore

scopecontent.p: The Department of Music (0.5 linear feet, 1955-2011, scattered) series contains posters from various concerts and programs including Symphonic Band concerts, Symphony and Philharmonia Orchestra concerts, Choir concerts, seminars, the Afro-American Music Collection, and general posters.

The Department of Musical Theater (1.0 linear feet), 1999-2012) series contains posters for productions produced by the Department of Musical Theater in cooperation with the various music organizations of the university.

did.unittitle: A Day in Hollywood, a Night in the Ukraine, 1992
If My Friends Could See Me Now, 1989
Sunday in the Park with George, 1994

scopecontent.p: The Department of Speech (3.0 linear feet, 1936-1972) series contains early posters from the Department before the School of Music divided into specific theatrical departments. The posters within include theater, musical theater, and opera.

did.unittitle: The Devil and Daniel Webster and Billy Budd
You Can't Take it With You, 1936

scopecontent.p: The Department of Theater and Drama (4.0 linear feet, 1946-2012, scattered) series contains general posters from the department, as well as from specific sub groups, including the Ensemble Theater, the Michigan Repertory, the University Showcase, the Professional Theater Program, the University Players, the Musket, and Project Theater.

unittitle.title: The Butterfingers Angel Mary and Joseph, Herod the Nut and the Slaughter of 12 Hit Carols in a Pear Tree

scopecontent.p: The Opera Theater (1.0 linear feet, 1997-2012) series contains posters from the shows of the University's opera division under the Department of Voice. Earlier opera productions are found under Department of Speech, and some are also found in the Department of Theater and Drama under the Professional Theater Program.

did.unittitle: The Dreamy Kid and De Organizer, 2006
La Serva Padrona and The Boor, 1993
L'Enfant et Les Sortileges (The Child and the Enchantments) and Le Rossignol (The Nightingale)
Old Maid and the Thief and Gianni Schicchi, 1982
The Turn of the Screw, 2 undated

scopecontent.p: The Oversize Folders (4 oversize folders, 1958-1991) contain large format posters from the other series. Under the Department of Music heading are posters from the Symphony Band, the Carillon Bell Tower recitals, the Choir, and the Symphony and Philharmonia Orchestra. Within the Department of Theater and Drama heading are posters from the Michigan Repertory, Musket Theater, Professional Theater Program, Project Theater, University Players and University Showcase

did.unittitle: Death of a Salesman, As You Like It, Purlie, and Camino Real
